intro: Chlorophytum ciliatum, commonly known as the spider plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring long, narrow leaves that are often striped with white or silver markings. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are followed by fluffy, white seed heads. It is well-known for its ability to thrive in a variety of conditions, making it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardening.
